loans.name: Niavelle

texts.en: Niavelle D. is from the village of Tagulalo, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 25 years old, is married, and has two infant children. Niavelle owns and operates a business planting and harvesting vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Niavelle joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. Niavelle is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Em P. is a married man, 27 years old. To help be support for family, Em P. is currently working as a security guard for a company and he gets a monthly salary of $100. His wife’s name is Khin Dany, age 23 (she appears in the picture). She is a sewing worker for a garment industry. This couple was married for years, but they have no a child. In the past, Em P. and his wife also hired a villager’s motorcycle to their workplace. Em P. would like to reduce the cost of hiring taxi by using his first loan to buy an old motorcycle which will allow him and his wife to commute to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle which will allow him and his wife to commute to work

loans.name: Thor

texts.en: Thor K. is 35 years old and resides with her husband and four children in the Takeo Province. She and her husband sell groceries in the village and are able to make about US $21 in revenue each day. This couple needs a loan of US $700 from CREDIT to diversify their products to meet their clients' demands.

loans.use: Buy grocery items

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente M. is from the village of Cabungaan Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 39 years old. Vicente is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Vicente plants, harvests, and sells corn. Vicente has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Vicente joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vicente has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Vicente is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be Vicente's second loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for his children's tuition and for daily needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Om

texts.en: Om T., 55, is a widow with one married child and resides in the Takeo province. To earn a living, she has been selling rice noodle and porridge in her community for about US$15 in revenue each day and is aided by her daughter who sells chickens at the market. Om T. is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase a motorbike for her daughter and leftover is reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike and reinvest in business.

loans.name: Nov

texts.en: Nov P., 37, is married and lives with her husband and two of her children in Takeo Province. She and her husband sell palm sugar to earn a living and are able to make US $10 each day in profits. To earn more money, this couple is asking for a loan of US $1200 to purchase a stock of palm sugar.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of palm sugar.

loans.name: Karn

texts.en: Karn R., 35, is married and resides with her husband and two young children in the Takeo province. Since 2008, she has been making rice wine and breeding pigs to earn a living and is able to make about US$2.5 each day, while her husband is a carpenter who is able to make US$4 per day. Karn R. is asking for a loan of US$800 to purchase rice she needs to make rice wine.

loans.use: Make rice wine.

loans.name: Kul

texts.en: Kul E. is 58 years old and resides with her husband in Takeo Province. She sells mosquito nets, pillows, mattresses, and mats, and typically makes US $33 in revenue each day. Her husband makes and sells hammocks at the local market. On average, he makes US $2 each day. Kul E. needs a loan of US $1000 to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To reinvest in her business.

loans.name: Vath

texts.en: Vath K. was born 1969 on her homeland located in Phnom Penh, where she established her own small family. Vath K. was married, but divorced her husband since her son was very young. To feed her family, she has built a small kiosk where she provides a tailoring service to her nearby neighbors who need her to sew their clothes. She sews both modern women clothe and men clothe and has been started in this sector for nine years. To help meet with the family’s living standard, her son works in construction. Vath K. currently lives with her older widowed mother who helps her in holding entire housework. The part of sewing material has been exhausted; Vath K. has asked for a loan to order more cloths to supply her good business.

loans.use: To order more cloths to supply her good business

loans.name: Frida

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 40 years old Frida L. from Mbozi. She is marriedwith 3 children, between the ages of 12  and 18. Frida has been running a shop  business since 2006. Client’s business is She owns a small duka or neighborhood shop in the city where she sells common household and grocery items. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Frida currently earns about 100USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase shop items in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to improve quality and range of product. Frida thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase shop items in bulk

loans.name: Vat

texts.en: Mrs. Vat V., 43, is a widowed mother who has been provided a birth to four kids. One of her daughters is working in the garment factory, while other three are dependent on her income. Vat V. currently lives in Phnom Penh, the capital, where she works sewing clothe at the same place with her daughter. On the other hand, Vat V. also grows a few vegetable on a piece of land located next to her house for extra profits. Vat V. said that currently her family's living conditions are not comfortable because her house is too old and often cracks down when the heavy rains are falling. That is why she requested a loan of US$600 to be used to pay a repairing house fee.

loans.use: To pay a repairing house fee

texts.es: Concepción Elena P. D. P., resiD. en el municipio D. San Martin del departamento D. San Salvador. Concepción tiene 50 años D. edad, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos D. 18 y 13 años D. edad quienes se encuentran estudiando. Concepción tiene su propio negocio el cual administra hace seis años, y que poco a poco ha ido creciendo con los esfuerzos D. Concepción, es una tienda con productos D. consumo que en esta oportunidad ella solicita D. un crédito para surtir su tienda y poder obtener mayores ganancias.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
“If there is hard work, there is progress.” This is the philosophy of Mary Ann  D. of Brgy. Villa Coloma in Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She graduated with only an elementary school education and is happily married to Leonard D.. They are blessed with nine children, seven girls and two boys. Three of the children are now in secondary school and the others are in elementary school. 

They are striving hard to earn an income to meet their needs and pay for the schooling of their children. Her husband works in one of the well-known bakeries in Bagabag. Mary Ann sells snacks, such as rice cakes, banana cue, and camote cue, and also some vegetables. Since she has very little capital, she joined Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc. (ASKI), a microfinance organization, and has applied for a loan of P 5,000.00 to buy additional items for her business. She hopes that she can improve her business and increase her income with the continuous support of ASKI.

loans.use: Additional capital for her snack business

loans.name: Latifa Group

texts.en:
Latifa is the group leader of this group. There are four members in this group. Each of them wants to take out a loan for expanding his/her business and making it larger. So they have requested a group loan of 56,000 Afghani. 

Latifa wants to take a loan for the business of tailoring. Abdul Wakail wants to take a loan for the business of fruit selling. Bibi Assell wants to take a loan for her curtain sewing shop. Khiber wants to take a loan for his taxi. So they are very happy with this process of small loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: For business progress

loans.name: Marcos

texts.en:
Marcos is 50 years old and he is married to Myrna M., and they have six children. Marcos is still sending some of his children to school. As a head of the family, Marcos is taking the responsibility to work to be able to provide the needs of his family. He hopes to improve their ways of living through the business he has. Marcos and his family lives in the mountainous village of Cabisera 25, Ilagan, Isabela. 

	Marcos is engaged in hog raising business for many years. He knows that he will not have daily income from raising hogs alone that’s why whenever he has time to does fishing he goes to the river to catch some fish to sell in their village. Aside from this, he is also indulged in producing charcoals which he sells in their village. The income he generates from the businesses that he is currently engaged with is being used to provide his family’s daily needs.

	Marcos hopes to further expand his businesses that's why he would like to obtain a loan of PHP4,000. It will give him a big benefit to improve his business and he hopes someday to engage in a more profitable business.

loans.use: additional capital to expand his hog raising business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline B. is popular as “Vangie” in their community. She is one of the inhabitants in Brgy. Villa Coloma, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 26 years old and finished only high school studies. Due to financial constraints, she is not able to pursue her college studies. She works as a maid and helps her parents to earn a living until she got married to Alexander B. and they are blessed with five children. For the sake of their daily living and future of their children, both of them work hard to earn income.
	As a way of gaining income, her husband works in a rice mill located at Boret, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya while Vangie engaged in fish, fruits and vegetable vending. She started it with a small capital, but being an industrious mother, she can able to earn a net income of Php 600.00 per week which they used to budget for their daily needs and for the education of their children. Since their children are in the highest stage of education, they need to earn more income to support their studies. In this regard, Evangeline joined the Microfinance Institution and applied for a loan amount of P 5,000.00 to be able to increase her capital for the improvement of her business. She hopes that with her patience and sacrifices, she can able to improve her small business and their children will be able to finish their studies.

loans.use: additional capital in selling fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 33 years old who resides in the village of Cabisera 25, Ilagan, Isabela. She is married to Rolando, a known carpenter in their village. They have two school-aged children; Rose Anne and Spencer. The couple has a dream of providing complete education to their children through the income they gain from their business. She hopes that their dreams will do come true with the help of God whom they trust. 
 Her husband Rolando is the one responsible in making furniture which is their main source of income. It has been their main source of income for five years already. Gina is requesting to avail a loan amounting to PHP4,000 for the improvement of their business. They need capital to purchase more needed materials for the development of their business. She is praying that her loan request will be approved.

loans.use: additional capital to purchase materials for making furniture

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
“In every sacrifice there’s a price,” says Imelda, a businesswoman who resides in La Salette, Benito Soliven, Isabela. She has three school-aged children and her husband works as a farmer in their village. The couple hopes that, through their determination to succeed, they will be able to provide a better life for their family.      
                                                                                                                                                                                                                              
Imelda has run a village store in their house since 1990. She uses some of her income to buy more groceries for her store. She just hopes to have more capital to further expand her business so it will become more profitable. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more items to fill in her store. She hopes to have the chance to be more productive for the welfare of her children.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia M. is from the village of Sibugon Lopez Jaena in Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Julia is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Julia provides manicures and pedicures in the local community. Julia has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Julia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from GDMPC. Julia is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP that she will use to purchase supplies and to expand the services that she provides. This loan will be Julia's second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

loans.name: Sai

texts.en: Sai S. is 48 years old widower man and father. Sai S. is a local cultivator who has been farming rice since 2000. He has now four single children, and they live together in a medium house located in Banteay Meanchey Province. Sai S. is a sacrificing and determined man who tries to earn money to feed his children since they were very young. He has encouraged his two children to attain suitable jobs: his daughter is selling grocery item from home and other one son raises poultry for a profit, and they both provided their income to support their family’s daily living expenses. Sai S. is taking out his loan as capital to be allowed to his daughter to order more her grocery inventories for sale.

loans.use: To order more her grocery inventories for sale

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena B. is from the village of San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 40 years old. Elena is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Elena owns & operates a "pedicab" transportation service. Elena has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Elena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to repair her existing vehicle for better service. Elena is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which she will use to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be Elena's third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions of the borrower's family and pay for her children's tuition. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Juvie Ann

texts.en:
Juvie Ann E. is a resident of Barangay Villa Coloma in Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 25 years old and she has an elementary-school education. Due to financial difficulty, she married without thinking about the consequences of early marriage. She is married to Oscar E. and they are blessed with three children. Due to our economic crisis, she realized that getting married early is not easy if you are not ready for it. She regrets her decision, but she can do nothing but fulfill her responsibility as a mother.

Since they don’t have a profession, her husband grows a variety of vegetables in their garden. Juvie opened a small store and eatery in front of their house to help her husband to earn enough income to suppport their children. She started her business with little capital and it earns a net income of Php 700 per week. Due to high cost of commodities and school expenses, she needs to increase her income to meet their needs. 

She wants to borrow money from Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc. (ASKI) to develop her business and increase her income. She has applied for Php 5,000 to improve her small store. She believes that she can able to improve her small business and support the education of their children with ASKI's help.

loans.use: Additional capital to improve her store

texts.en:
Night B. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs at the resturant  and is requesting a loan to purchase more beans and pulses.  Night is 37 years old and is Married with a husband that is prison officer. She has 1 child and her child does not go to school.  BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia M. is currently in the business of selling local Sudanese bread cooked in the cooking oil and is requesting a loan to purchase more baking flour. 

 Cicilia is 40 years old and is Married with a husband that is a police man. She has 5 children and her children go to school.  

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to send her children to school. 

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more baking flour

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es: Manuel De Jesús M. reside en el departamento de Santa Ana. Manuel tiene 51 años de edad vive con su dos hijos Salvador y Diego que tienen 18 años de edad, y se encuentran estudiando. Manuel tiene un panadería que abrió hace cinco años y la que hoy le da estabilidad económica a su familia, Manuel recibe apoyo de sus hijos que por las tardes libres después de la escuela , ayudan en el negocio familiar, su clientela es muy estable ya que la panadería se encuentra ubicada en calle principal con mucha afluencia. El crédito que solita Manuel es para compra insumos que le permitan aumentar su producción de pan.

loans.use: Compra de insumos

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa owns a general store in her village. She started her business just this year and it gets stronger over time. She hopes to have additional capital to further expand her business. She needs a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase more commodities so that she can become more competent and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to get the chance to further improve her business. 

"Higher capital means higher income”, said Narcisa, when asked why she joined ASKI. She hopes to have more income through the help of lenders. She aspires to improve their poor living condition, so she is very eager to earn more income. “These are all for the benefit of my family”, she adds.

loans.use: To buy more commodities to sell

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer L. is from the village of Poblacion 4 in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old. Jennifer is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Jennifer owns and operates a "sari-sari" (variety) store where she sells vegetables in the local community. Jennifer has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Jennifer joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jennifer has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. Jennifer is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP that she will use to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Jennifer's 9th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Juan Ramón

texts.es: Juan Ramón C. V. reside en el departamento de Santa Tecla  en el municipio de La Libertad. Juan vive con sus dos hijos quienes ya son mayores de edad y se encuentran trabajando. Juan tiene una panadería con quince años de experiencia, que le han permitido ganar mucha clientela, en la panadería de Juan solo se elabora pan francés que luego es  distribuido en tiendas de la zona. El crédito que solicita es para comprar materiales que le den la oportunidad de aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Juan Ramón C. V. lives in the Santa Tecla neighborhood in the city of La Libertad. He lives with his two children who are grown and have jobs.

Juan has a bakery, a business he has had for 15 years. In that time, he has gained a large clientele. He makes only French bread, which he distributes to be sold in stores in the area. With this loan, Juan will buy materials that will allow him to increase production.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies for the bakery

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma operates her own general store which is located in front of their house.  She begun operating her retailing business since year 1990 and it is presently doing great. She hopes to avail a loan amounting to PHP7,000 to maintain and further expand her business. She hopes that her income will increase to provide sufficient needs to her family. 
Norma describes herself as a jolly person who frequently makes her children laugh. She is happily married and has five children, some are studying and some are still infants. She dreams to send all her children to college someday which is the reason why she already prepares herself by engaging into business.  Their family lives peacefully in the village of La Salette, Benito Soliven, Isabela.

loans.use: additional capital to further expand her store

loans.name: Enkhtuya

texts.en:
Enkhtuya A. is a single mother who lives with her 2-year-old daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. She and her daughter live in a "ger," a yurt or traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.  Enkhtuya operates a used-clothing business in the Narantuul Market, one of the largest and most crowded markets in Ulaanbaatar. She started her business in 2003 with the help of her supportive aunt, and now she owns her own stall at the market and is getting more customers every day. 

This successful business has allowed Enkhtuya to buy her own ger where she and her daughter can live comfortably.  She lost both of her parents when she was a young child, and because of that, she wants her daughter to have everything that she never had.  This is why Enkhtuya works hard every day and is making the most out of her clothing business. She would like to learn how to drive and purchase a car so that she can pick up items for her business instead of having to rely on delivery drivers. 

Enkhtuya is requesting a loan of 1,700,000 tugtug (~1200 USD) to purchase clothing, such as socks and jeans from China.

loans.use: To purchase clothing, such as socks and jeans, from China

loans.name: Elunia

texts.en: Elunia A., who is currently in the business of selling green vegetables, beans, etc., is requesting a loan to purchase dried fish to sell. Thirty years old and widowed, Elunia has six children, all attending school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy dried fish to sell

loans.name: Chiquito

texts.en: Chiquito C. is from the village of Panalsalan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. He is 33 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Chiquito owns and operates a business selling seafood to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Chiquito joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from GDMPC. Chiquito is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for his seafood business. This loan will be his third from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for his business

loans.name: Eduardo Antonio

texts.es: Eduardo Antonio M. de 62 años de edad, reside en La Libertad municipio del departamento de Santa Tecla. Eduardo vive con su hijos , su esposa y su tía Marta de 92 años edad que necesita de cuidos por su edad. Eduardo se dedica a la reparación y venta de relojes, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en una zona de mucha afluencia de Sata Tecla, donde le permite a Eduardo ser visto por muchos clientes, ahora el solicita de un crédito para comprar brazaletes y baterías que utiliza para la reparación de relojes.

loans.use: comprar brazaletes y baterías

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Dudu

texts.en:
Dudu R. is currently in the business of selling phaste and bread and is requesting a loan to purchase beans and pulses to sell.  Dudu is 30 years old and is Married with a husband that is a police man. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase  beans and pulses to sell

loans.name: Adelyn

texts.en: Adelyn L. is from the city of Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City. She is 48 years old, is married, and has nine school-aged children. Adelyn owns and operates a "sari-sari" retail store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Adelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita O. sells coconut wine for additional income in her family. She has 10 children. Her eldest child is 23 years old. She is married for nearly 20 years now. She was engaged into coconut wine selling. She sells a variety of goods like rice and laundry soaps. The income she makes from her business helps a lot to buy her family enough food, clothes and other basic needs. 

She would like to apply for a loan of Php 4,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to be able to buy additional stocks of raw coconut wine  for her store and earn more income for their daily needs. 

She has been a a member of Community Economic Vnetures Inc. for quite a long time now. She likes the services because it has only 2% interest rate which is very  low and affordable to repay.

loans.use: Coconut wine selling

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita B. P. de 52 años de edad reside en el departamento de Santa Tecla junto a sus tres hijos y su esposo. Margarita es una mujer muy trabajadora y da todo por su familia, hace once años ella inicio su negocio, con el deseo de apoyar a su esposo en los gastos familiares y es así como hasta el día de ahora Margarita sostiene su negocio en el mercado municipal de Santa Tecla donde vende calzado  y productos de nutrición, el crédito que solita es para surtir su negocio.

loans.use: surtir su negocio.

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Ganjuur

texts.en: Ganjuur A. lives with her husband and twin daughters in a house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her older two children are married and live in the Dundgobi province of Mongolia and herd livestock for a living. One of younger daughters attends the Agriculture university and the other wanths to become a hairdresser. A. operates a fruit retail business in a mobile stall in Ulaanbaatar with the help of her husband. She purchases fruit from the Narantuul and Bars markets, the two largest markets in Ulaanbaatar, and sell them to people for a profit. A. and her husband are a very hardworking couple who have managed to build their house with their fruit stand profits. Her current working capital exceeds 300,000 tugrug (~210 USD) and she is planning on opening one more mobile stall where her husband can operate separately.  A. is requesting a 700,000 tugrug (~492 USD) loan in order to afford her daughter’s tuition fee so that she might be able to get job in the city after graduation and live closer to her parents.

loans.use: To afford her daughter’s tuition fee at the Agricultural University

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es: María Del Carmen M. F. reside en Mejicanos municipio de San Salvador. María es madre soltera, vive solamente con su hijo Erick de 2 años de edad. María siempre ha sido una persona muy responsable y trabajadora lo que ha dado como resultado catorce años de éxito en su negocio, un comedor que lleva por nombre MARY. El destino del crédito que solicita María, es para comprar vitrinas, mesas y pintar local; con el objetivo de mantener  un espacio agradable para sus clientes.

loans.use: Mejoras a su negocio

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en: Anabelle R. is from the village of Nailon, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Anabelle owns and operates a "sari-sari" retail store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Anabelle joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Anabelle is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Chhem

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhem S. is a 48-year-old married woman and the mother of six children. Five of them are single and the other one is married and lives independently. One of her sons provides a labor service for the local need of ice blocks.

From day to day, Chhem S. goes to buy the necessary ingredients she uses for her cupcakes. She makes them and sells them to the middlemen in bulk and the rest she takes to the market to sell retail. She usually earns an average of $3 a day to be managed for all her family’s living needs.

Chhem S.’s husband is a motor taxi driver. He is buying a motorbike that requires a tax, so Chhem S. would like a loan which will enable her husband to pay the tax. She proposes to use the rest of her loan to sustain her business capital.

loans.use: To pay the tax for her husband's motorbike

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Farming and the vending of vegetables is what Maria Elena is busy with. She is 37 years of age and married to Saturnino S.. They have been blessed with seven children: Ronald - 16 years old, who is a van driver's assistant; Roldan - 15 years old, a high school student; Romel - 13 years old who is in 2nd year high school; Romar - 12 years old, a grade six pupil; Reinz - 9 years old, who is in grade-III; Michelle - 7 years of age, a grade-II pupil; and Julius Andrie - 3 years old. Though she has a large number of family members, still she is thankful to our Almighty God for the continuous support to be able to provide for the needs for her family.

Maria Elena also manages a vegetable garden and she wants to maintain it to increase the vegetables that she harvests from her garden. Maria Elena is asking Kiva lenders for PHP 5,000 as additional capital. She is hoping that she will be able to obtain the loan so that she can buy some fertilizer and pesticide for her vegetable garden.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Angua

texts.en:
Angua L. is currently in the business of selling onions and cooking oil and is requesting a loan to purchase tomatoes and Irish potatoes to sell.  Angua is 29 years old and is married with a husband who is a soldier. She has three children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase tomatoes and potatoes to sell

loans.name: Kelli Consuelo

texts.es: Kelli Consuelo G. R. de 27 años de edad, reside en Santa Catalina del departamento de Sonsonate. Kelli vive junto a sus padres, con su esposo y sus dos hijos menores de edad. Kelli ayuda a su esposo con los ingresos que obtienen de su negocio, una tienda de granos básicos y productos de consumo, la familia de G. es muy conocida en el pueblo por ser personas honradas y muy trabajadoras. El deseo de Kelli y su esposo es poder comprar su propia casa, pero para ello necesitan de muchos ahorros es por eso que Kelli desea surtir su negocio, para poder aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Kelli Consuelo G. R., 27, lives in Santa Catalina in the Sonsonate department. Kelli lives with her parents, her husband, and their two minor children. Kelli helps her husband with the income they get from her business, a store selling basic grains and consumable products. The Gracía family is very well known in the town for being honorable and very hard working people. Kelli and her husband wish to be able to buy their own house. To do so they need a lot of savings. That is why Kelli wants to stock her business to be able to increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita T. is a seaweed grower. She has two children. Her eldest child is five years old and is ready to receive elementary education next year. She works all day to be able to earn an income to provide for their daily needs. The reason why she continually ensures the abundant growth of seaweed at her farm is to be able to save money for the future education of her children.

She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy more seaweed seedlings. Now that she aims for business expansion, she needs more capital to realize all her business plans. Receiving a loan is truly worthwhile because this will help her increase her ability to produce income.

loans.use: To buy seaweed seedlings

loans.name: Felomena

texts.en:
Felomena is the kind of businesswoman who prefers to always be busy. She sells different kinds of fruits and vegetables in Baclaran, a place far away from her home. Most of the fruit she sells come from various villages in the town where she lives. She gathers them all together and delivers by truck, or commonly known as a “backload” in the village. She also goes to Baclaran and personally sells the fruit. The income she generates from selling fruit is being used to purchase other products, such as clothes, which she sells in the village. 

Felomena is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 4,000 to have additional capital for her retail business. She aims to further expand her business and she needs capital to be able to purchase more products. In this way, her income will increase. She hopes that her loan request will be granted.

Felomena is 50 years old, but for her, age doesn’t matter in business. She just hopes to remain strong and healthy to pursue what she started in business. Her family owns more than a hectare of farmland and it is being cultivated by her humble husband, Damian. They have four children, but they did not pursue their studies due to early marriage. She hopes that with the help of her business, she can manage to give a little help to her children.

loans.use: To purchase products for resale

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Obtimia

texts.es: Obtimia O. T. de 53 años de edad reside el departamento de Santa Ana. Obtimia es madre soltera  de  dos hijos que son su orgullo, vive con ellos y con la esposa de su hijo mayor. Obtimia se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, hasta el día de hoy ella maneja y atiende de sus negocios, tiene una venta de pupusas, sorbetes y panes; el crédito que solicita es para comprar insumos que le den la oportunidad de aumentar la producción de sus panes y pupusas.
texts.en:
Obtimia O. T., 53, lives in the Santa Ana department. Obtimia is a single mother with two children who are her pride. She lives with them and the wife of her older son. Obtimia is characterized as being a very hard-working woman. To this day she manages and takes care of her business. She sells “pupusas” (stuffed tortillas), sherbet, and bread. The loan she is asking for is to buy supplies to increase production of her breads and “pupusas”.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies for food

loans.name: Ijau

texts.en: Ijau S. is currently in the business of selling pulses, beans etc  and is requesting a loan to stock more beans to sell.  Ijau is 32 years old and is Widowed.   She has 1 child and her child goes to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her daughter BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock more beans to sell

loans.name: Iliyas

texts.fr: Iliyas B. is 47 years old and lives with his wife and seven children in the Bayan-Ulgii province of western Mongolia. His children range in age from 2 years old to 20 years old. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. B. operates a construction business specializing in small homes and storage buildings. He usually finishes each order within ten days and receives between 400,000 and 450,000 tugrugs (~280-316 USD) per order. In order to supplement his income, he also works as a stoker at a local company during the winter time. His wife takes care of their children and knits socks for orders to support the family income. He would one day like to be able to open a furniture making business in addition to his construction business. He says, “My only wish is to be able to afford my children’s education”. B. is requesting a 600,000 tugrug (~420 USD) loan in order to purchase tools for his construction business and to pay for his children’s tuition fees.
texts.en:
Iliyas B. is 47 years old and lives with his wife and seven children in the Bayan-Ulgii province of western Mongolia. His children range in age from 2 years old to 20 years old. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. B. operates a construction business specializing in small homes and storage buildings. He usually finishes each order within ten days and receives between 400,000 and 450,000 tugrugs (~280 to 316 USD) per order. In order to supplement his income, he also works as a stoker at a local company during the winter time. His wife takes care of their children and knits socks for orders to support the family income. He would one day like to be able to open a furniture making business in addition to his construction business. He says, “My only wish is to be able to afford my children’s education”. B. is requesting a 600,000 tugrug (~420 USD) loan in order to purchase tools for his construction business and to pay for his children’s tuition fees.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tools for his construction business and to pay for his children’s tuition fees

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo A. is a seaweed farmer. He grows and sells seaweeds in the island to be able to pay the daily expenses in their home. From his business, he earned enough money which he uses to buy food, clothes and other basic needs. The income as well is very helpful in sending his children to school. 

He would like to request a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. He will use the loan to be able to buy the needed seaweed seedlings for his business expansion. The seaweeds is sold per kilo and the more strand of seaweeds he plants, the more income he will make for his family.  He is doing the best he can to provide his 4 children a better life.

loans.use: To buy seaweed seedlings

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 43 years old and lives in Cabisera 25, Ilagan, Isabela. She is married and has three children: Roland, Orly and Luzilyn. Luzviminda is striving hard to make her business more profitable in order to sustain the needs of her children. Her husband sells bamboo in different villages. 

Luzviminda has a business buying and selling personal products, such as Avon, in her village. She started her business in 2003, and she is aiming to further expand her business. In addition, Luzviminda also sells snacks and food in the village. It is of great benefit to her family because it is where their daily allowances come from. 

Luzviminda requests loan of PHP 5,000 to use as additional capital in maintaining and improving the business. This amount will be of big help to make her business more profitable. Soon, with her profits, she may also be able to contribute to the progress of her husband’s business. She hopes that through this loan, they can gradually improve their way of living.

loans.use: Capital to maintain and improve her sales business

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es: Juan Alberto L. P. reside en Nahuizalco en el departamento de Sonsonate junto a su esposa quien es profesora  y sus tres hijos. Juan se dedica a la carpintería, profesión con la cual ha sacado a delante a su familia, en la carpintería de Juan se elabora variedades de artículos hechos por él , también en el negocio ayudan sus hijos quienes demuestran tener la habilidad de su padre,  el crédito solita Juan es para comprar madera y otros materiales para su negocio.

loans.use: Comprar insumos para su carpinteria

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia A. is a seaweed grower. She has grown seaweed to be able to buy her family food, clothes and other needs. She has seven children. The income she makes from her seaweed farm is what her family depends on for living every day.

She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy seaweed seedlings. The loan will help her achieve better income to support the education of her children as well.

loans.use: To purchase seaweed seedlings

loans.name: Tseien-Ish

texts.en: B. is 25 years old and lives with his wife and four year old son in the Zavkhan province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. B. operates a cell phone and cell phone part retail business in his town. The cell phone industry in Mongolia has exploded in recent years as many people rely on their cell phones as their only means of communication with people in other parts of the country since both land lines and internet access can still be prohibitively expensive. B. began his business in 2006 and because of his strong customer service skills and stable business operation, he has become very successful. He hopes to soon expand his business further and open his own small shop where he can continue growing his enterprise. B. is requesting a 3,500,000 tugrug (~2460 USD) loan in order to purchase new cell phones and cell phone parts for his business.

loans.use: To purchase new cell phones and cell phone parts for his business

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en: Jessica P. owns a jeepney. She earns regular income by transporting people going to and fro Talibon.  She has nine children. Her eldest child is 18 years old and is very excited to go to college. She wants to earn more money to support all the needs in their home. That is why she requested for a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. to be able repair her damage jeepney. After the jeepney will be repaired, she will again have an income for her family.

loans.use: To repair jeepney

loans.name: Sasi

texts.en:
Sasi J. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs at the resturant  and is requesting a loan to purchase more tables and chairs in her resturant.  Sasi is 25 years old and is Married with a husband that is a driver. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rental purpose.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more tables and chairs her resturant

loans.name: Chin

texts.en: Chin K. is 47 years old and resides in the Siem Reap province with her husband and two of her children. To earn a living, she has been growing and selling vegetables at the local market. She typically makes about $1 of profit every day. Her husband, pictured here, is a carpenter who is able to make around $5 each day. Chin is asking for a loan of $1,000 for her husband to be able to purchase wood and carpenter tools to expand his business.

loans.use: Buy wood and carpenter tools

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza, 35 years old, is married to Remar. They have two children: Marianne Nizette, 4 years old, and Remzon Luiz, 4 months old. This couple hopes that they can be able to continue supporting their family's needs until such time that they will begin sending their children to school. 

Annaliza is vending RTWs -- Ready To Wear clothes -- and cosmetics products. She would like to buy more RTWs and cosmetics products for her to generate more income. Her husband is a salesman at Makati. Annaliza would like to apply for a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 5,000. She hopes that she can sustain her children’s needs. This loan will be used to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more products for resale

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther R. is from the village of Mitan-ag Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Esther is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Esther owns and operates a "sari-sari", a specialized general store, where she sells daily use products and dried goods in the local community. Esther has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Esther joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esther has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Esther is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Esther from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith C. is engaged into multiple business. Aside from fish, she also has a photocopy machine, where she got enough income to buy her family food, clothes and other basic needs. She requested a loan of PHP 25,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy more fish for resale. The loan will really help her expand her business and income as well.

loans.use: To  buy more fish for resale and fund her photocopying business

loans.name: Kao

texts.en: Kao S., 43, is married with five children. She lives with husband and children in Battambong Province. She is engaged in a business of sewing clothes and repairing motorbikes with one of her sons (pictured), earning collectively an income of US $5 per day. Her husband is employed at a private company as a security guard, earning an income of US $1.5 per day. This couple tries to work hard everyday to ensure a comfortable standard of living for the family. S. is asking for a loan of US $500 to purchase motorbike spare parts to expand the business of repairing motorbikes. S. hopes that the expected loan she is going to invest in her business will be successful so that she is able to generate more income for her household use.

loans.use: purchase motorbike spare parts

loans.name: Moeurn

texts.en: Moeurn L. is 33 years old and lives with her husband and two of her children in the Siem Reap province. She sells rice noodle and makes about US$4 per day, while her husband is a farmer who typically make US$6 in revenue a day. He usually buys a stock of rice and yam and resells it to wholesaler at the market. Moeurn L. is asking for a loan of US$500 to purchase rice in bulk so he can has a special discount from seller. (Moeurn was not available so her husband is pictured instead)

loans.use: Buy and sell rice.

loans.name: Sebi

texts.en:
Sebi E. is currently in the business of selling used clothes and is requesting a loan to purchase bedsheets to sell.  Sebi is 38 years old and is Married with a husband that is a nurse. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a hotel.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase bedsheets to sell

loans.name: Larng

texts.en:
Larng H., 58, is married with three children. She lives with her husband and children in Battambong Province. She manufactures a kind of Cambodian traditional cake made from rice and used for rolling meat and vegetables, earning an income of $5 per day, which is the primary source of income for the family. She is assisted by two of her children in the process of preparing those products. Her husband is hired to produce different kinds of furniture, especially tables, earning approximately an income of $2 per day. Another source of income for the family is generated from one of H.’s children who sells clothes in the town located at the border of Cambodia and Thailand. 

H. is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase a trailer and a motorbike attached together to transport rice and grains. She hopes that her new business plan, in which she will invest the expected loan, will be successful.

loans.use: Purchase a motorbike and a trailer for transporting food items

loans.name: Jose Adán

texts.es: Jose Adán H. reside en el departamento de Santa Ana en el occidente de El Salvador. Jose tiene 59 años de edad, vive con su esposa y su hijo. Jose tiene una larga trayectoria, son treinta años que marcan a Jose en su profesión de sastre que consiste en confeccionar ropa  a la medida, el crédito que pide hoy Jose es para comprar tela e hilos que le permitan elaborar uniformes paraluego ser comercializados.
texts.en:
Jose Adán H. lives in the Santa Ana department in the western part of El Salvador. Jose is 59, and he lives with his wife and son. Jose has a long track record. He has been a tailor for 30 years. He makes custom-made clothes. The loan that Jose is asking for is to buy fabric and thread that will allow him to make uniforms to be sold later.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric and thread

loans.name: Demberel

texts.en:
Demberel E. is 25 years old and lives with his wife in Khovd province in western Mongolia. He and his wife live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. E. owns and operates a cafe in his town. His menu includes a variety of traditional Mongolian meals such as lapsha /noodle soup/, buuz /steamed meat dumplings/ and huushuur /fried flour meat pockets/. E. opened his cafe in 2005 with the help of his wife. He runs the business and his wife cooks. E. also operates a meat trading business to supplement his family's income. He is requesting a 500,000 tugrug (~350 USD) loan to purchase groceries and meat for his businesses.							

Demberel's wife, who helps run the cafe is pictured above

loans.use: To purchase groceries and meat for his businesses

loans.name: Bathuu

texts.en:
Bathuu A. is 36 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the Khovd province of western Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. All three of A.’s children attend a local secondary school while his wife helps him out with his business. A. operates a dairy product retail business in his town at the local market. He purchases all of his dairy products from the Arkhangai province which is known nationally for its wonderful dairy. A. attributes his business success to his knowledge of the local market demands. He is requesting a 2,500,000 tugrug (~1750 USD) loan in order to purchase more dairy products to sell during the upcoming winter months when prices for such products traditionally rise.										

One of Bathuu's daughters, who occasionally helps out with his dairy retail business is pictured above

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products to sell during the upcoming winter months

loans.name: Los

texts.en: Los R. is 33 years old and resides in the Siem Reap province with her husband and four children. She sells fish at the market to earn a living and is able to make about US$7 each day. Since 2007, her husband has selling rice for a daily income. He typically makes US$5 per day. Three of their children are in school and one is too young to attend. Los R. is asking for a loan of US$700 to purchase more rice and fish her business.

loans.use: Buy and sell fish.

loans.name: Mhammad

texts.en:
Mhammad is a 52 year old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon with his wife and three children. Mhammad has been a carpenter for twenty seven years. He constructs bedrooms, kitchen's doors and all kinds of furniture. Mhammad has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase raw materials like  wood to make furniture. This is his third cycle and he has always paid on time. 
His previous loans helped him improve his business and get more experience. His clients are his friends and the public. When Mhammad first started his business, he had to face the challenges of having his own business. In the future, Mhammad plans on improving his business and purchasing his own store.

loans.use: To purchase raw material.

loans.name: Vaida

texts.en:
Vaida J. is 28 years old and married with a husband who is a businessman. She has 3 children who go to school.  She is currently in the business of selling various items in her shop and is requesting a loan to purchase bags of salt and sugar to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, Vaida hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase bags of salt and sugar to sell

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina S. D. M. resiD. en San Martin municipio del departamento D. San Salvador. Marina cuenta con 49 años D. edad, vive con su esposo y su hijo Carlos D. 19 años D. edad. El esposo D. Marina trabaja fuera D. casa como panificador, mientras  Marina instalo hace unos años una tienda en su casa, al ver que no se encontraba con competencia a los alrededores, ahora Marina maneja su negocio por el cual solicita este crédito para surtirlo D. variedad D. productos.
texts.en:
Marina S. D. M. lives in the San Martin municipality in the San Salvador department. Marina, 49, lives with her husband and her 19 year old son, Carlos. Marina’s husband works outsiD. of the home as a baker. A few years ago Marina set up a store in her house. She saw that there was no competition around. Now Marina runs the business. She is asking for a loan to stock her store with a variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Srey S., 36, is married with 5 children. She lives with her husband her elderly mother (pictured) in Battambong Province. She is engaged in the businesses of selling vegetables and sewing clothes in a local market, earning an income of approximately US $3 per day. Her husband operates his motor taxi and provides his transportation services to people in the town and markets, earning an income of US $4 per day as a primary source of income for the family. S. is asking for a loan of US $700 to purchase a motorbike to transport more vegetables to sell at the market. Also, the motorbike will be useful for them to transport their children to school and thus cut back on public transportation expenses.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel D. is from the city of Gango Ozamiz City. He is 47 years old. Samuel is married and has 3 school-age children. To make a living, Samuel owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling woods in the local community. Samuel has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Samuel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Samuel is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Samuel from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Suon

texts.en: Suon S., 27, is married and lives with her husband in the Siem Reap province. She works in a grocery store, making around US$4 each day, while her husband, pictured here, is a construction foreman and is able to make about US$10 per day. This couple has one little child who is just able to attend the school. Suon S. would like to take out a loan of US$1000 to purchase construction tools for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase construction tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a large amount of meat to sell this winter

loans.name: Abaass

texts.en:
Abaass is a 23 year old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, southern suburbs of Lebanon with his wife. Abaass has been a car painter for two years and a half. He works in the service and the maintenance of vehicles. Abaass requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to  purchase raw materials for business and reimburse his debts. Abaass is his second cycle and he has always paid on time. 
His previous loan helped to start a family with a view to marriage. Abaass is characterized by his fast to implement all tasks entrusted to him. His clients are neighbors, friends or can be anybody. He had no liquidity at the beginning of his work but he was mastered in his business. Abaass plans to open a second branch in the future in the purpose of enlarging business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for business.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea S. is a vegetable seller living in Banteay Meanchey province. She, 37, is the good mother blessed with two school-aged kids. She is married to Chet Bunchoum, age 37. He owns a small garage where he provides a washing vehicle service. He has employees to help provide his service. Chea S.’s husband has been sharing a service for years ago, but he is still required more equipments to better support the good service he provides. Because of lacking money, Chea S. is requesting a loan from Kiva’s partner HKL which will afford to her husband to buy a washing washing tool for his service. Note: Mrs. Chea S.’s husband and their employee worker appear in the photo above, because Chea S. was not available at that time.

loans.use: To buy a washing vehicle tool for his service

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta S. is from the village of Romarate, Aurora, Zamboanga del sur. She is 38 years old. Crisanta is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Crisanta owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized a "sari-sari" retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, rice and feeds in the local community. Crisanta has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Crisanta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Crisanta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Crisanta is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Crisanta from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and pay the tuition of her children.. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Karema Hamida Group

texts.en:
Karema and Hamida are the group leaders of Karema Hamida group. There are four members in this group. They all want to take out a loan for their businesses to make them larger. So they have requested a group of loan of 56000 Afghani. 

Karema and Shafiqa want to take a loan for their husbands who have general stores. Hamida wants to receive a loan for her husband who has a cookie and bread shop. Shakila also wants to take a loan for her husband who has fruit shop. They admire this process of small loans.

loans.use: For expanding their businesses

loans.name: Jamts

texts.en: Jamts M. is 52 years old and lives with his wife and 23 year old daughter in Zavkhan province in western Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Both his wife and daughter work as cooks at different restaurants in the area. M. operates a taxi service in his town. He started driving a taxi in 2000 after purchasing a car imported from Korea. After several successful years, he used his earnings to buy a new car in 2008. M.'s business is very important to him and his family. He says, "All I want is to continue to provide for my family in the future." He is requesting a 1,100,000 tugrug (~750 USD) loan to purchase machinery parts for his car.

loans.use: To purchase machinery parts for his car

loans.name: Morm

texts.en: Morm H., 47, lives in the Siem Reap with her husband and six of her children. She is a wedding chef who typically makes US$1.50 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who builds houses. On average he makes US$5 each day. This couple is aided by two of their children who are also construction workers like their father. Morm H. would like to take out a loan of US$1200 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. This will reduce the daily transportation cost. (Morm H. and her husband were not available when the picture was taken so their eldest son is pictured instead)

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Yorng

texts.en: Yorng S. is married with three children. She lives with her husband and children in Battambong Province. She has been involved in a business of selling vegetable at a local market in the town, earning approximately an income of US $2.5 per day. Her husband purchases recycle material from place to place for resale, earning an income of US $3 per day. The family is also assisted by one of S.’s children who is currently employed as a construction worker, earning collectively an income of US $2.5 per day. She is asking for a loan of US $600 to have her husband repaired and invest on the recycling business. By doing so, S. hopes that her husband will be able to generate more income and save the money for the good future her children’s education.

loans.use: repair motorbike

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 39 year old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh in the  southern suburbs of Lebanon with his wife and their child. Hasan has been selling espresso coffee for three years. He has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise and phone cards for his work. This is the first time that Hasan has requested a loan. 
His clients are his neighbors and people from his region. Hasan decided on this business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans on opening a shop to sell mobile phones and phonecards.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and phone cards for his work.

loans.name: Orshikh

texts.en: Orshikh T. is 37 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Hovd province in western Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest son and daughter attend a local secondary school and her youngest son is in kindergarten. T. operates a grocery trading business in her town. She started her business in 1998 with the help of her husband and has steadily grown her business over the years. In 2009, T. began growing and selling her own vegetables. She rented a field and was able to plant and harvest nearly 4 tons of potatoes and 5 tons of carrots. Next year, she is planning to have her own 7 hectare field. T. is working hard to further grow her business and improve her family's quality of life. She is requesting a 2,500.000 tugrug (~1750 USD) loan to purchase 5 tons of beets and 5 tons of cabbage to sell in her grocery trading business.

loans.use: To purchase 5 tons of beets and 5 tons of cabbage to sell in her grocery trading business

loans.name: Chhen

texts.en: Chhen R., 42, is a wedding chef who lives in the Siem Reap province with her husband and four of her children. She typically makes about US$2 each day, while her husband is a farmer who typically makes about US$1 each day and is supported by their son working as a mechanic. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. Chhen R. is asking for a loan of US$500 to purchase a motorbike for family transportation. (Chhen and her husband were not available so their son is pictured instead)

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 50 year old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, southern suburbs of Lebanon with his wife and his four children. Ahmad has been selling shoes for twenty four years. He requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to buy merchandise for work. Ahmad has been a microcredit client for eight years now and has always paid on time. 
Ahmad took out his loans to improve his quality of life by buying goods and get profits because when he started learning the business, he faced difficulties in having capitA. to own a shop. His clients are his friends and neighbors as well as people in region. In the future, Ahmad plans on improving and enlarging his work.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for work.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
Wilfredo B. is from the village of Cabungaan Clarin. He is 34 years old. Wilfredo is married and has 2 school-age children. To make a living, Wilfredo owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector  raising crops.
