loans.name: Petty Trader Group

texts.en:
Petty Trader Group is a group of five borrowers led by James K., 59 years old. He is married with five children aged 21 to 31 years old with educational levels of 9th grade through university graduate. He also cares for an orphan. James is a 3rd grade drop-out who could not continue high school due to poverty. He and his family live in Mamba Point but work in the Ralay Town market which happens to be the biggest food market in southern Monrovia, Liberia.

James’ business is construction supplies. He buys construction supplies wholesale like nails, locks, screws, etc., and sells to residents of downtown Monrovia. He has been running this business for thirty years and started with funds generated from savings when he was employed. He left his job in 1968 to go into business.

James talks to his customers in a good manner so as to maintain them and encourage new buyers to continue buying from him. He plans to become an international businessman in the future.

James needs this loan in order to buy more goods for his business. He dreams of making himself and his family successful and of improving their lives.

loans.use: To buy more goods for his business

loans.name: Faith's Group

texts.en:
N. Faith is 56 years old. She is a determined and hardworking lady with a crafts and catering business that she has operated in Butebe for four years. She makes African crafts and arts and her major challenge is that the crafts materials are expensive, hence limiting her profit to 90,000/= a week.

Faith has a dream of expanding her business to start exporting her crafts as well as building rental accommodation for increased income. She needs a loan to help expand her business since the profits made from it help to pay school fees for her five children as well as enabling her to take care of other orphans.

loans.use: To buy materials for making more crafts

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose M. is a 44-year-old single mother of three children. She also takes care of additional family members. Rose M. rents a three-roomed house where she lives with eight people. The family has access to electricity and piped water. She lives and works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. Rose M. sells African batiks and bitengi (African wears) in Kampala city. She incurs transport costs going to and from Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda, but she doesn’t pay rent for her business as she works from her home. She sells to all categories of people, both retail and wholesale. Rose M. has been in this business for eight years, and with Kiva partner MCDT for five years, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bitengi for resale. She aspires to see her business grow bigger and own a fully stocked shop.

loans.use: To buy more bitengi (African clothing) for resale

loans.name: Aidah

texts.en:
Aidah is 48 and married with six children between the ages of 14 and 22. All her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members. Aidah resides in and owns a four-room house, where she is staying with five people. There is electricity and piped water at home. The family gets two meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. 

Aidah sells second-hand clothes on Lubaga road, one of roads leading to Kampala city. She incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping at Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda. She doesn’t pay rent for her business as she works from her home. She sells to all categories of people on both a retail and wholesale basis. 

Aidah has been in this business for six years and also with MCDT for six years. She is now servicing her 15th loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of clothes. Aidah aspires to see her business grow bigger and to start going directly to Dubai for second-hand clothes.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Lumuli A Tusubira Babirye Group

texts.en: T. Babirye is fifty years old; a widow blessed with six children the last born still schooling. She has four dependents that she is taking care of and they are schooling too. She is involved in brick making activity where by it is so far three years while making bricks. She is requesting for the loan to purchase iron sheets to make a shade for her bricks, pay the wages to people who normally help her and so forth. She is a hardworking business woman trying very hard to educate her children and more so her dream is to purchase car.

loans.use: To purchase iron sheets to make a shade for her bricks, pay the wages to people who normally help her and so forth.

loans.name: Nantume Jane ‘S Group

texts.en: Jane is a 60 year single mother of seven children aged between 30 and 42 years. None of her children go to school .She takes care of additional family members. Jane resides and rents a two roomed house where she is staying with five people. There is electricity and piped water at home  The family gets two meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala. Jane sells charcoal on Lubaga road one of roads samosas and chapattis in Kawempe and doesn’t incur extra transport costs to and from shopping.  She doesn’t pay rent for her business as she works from her home. She sells to all categories of people both on retail and whole sale Jane has been in this business for six years and with MCDT for also six years, servicing her fifteenth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of wheat flour and jerrycans of cooking oil. Jane is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and starting a full bakery.

loans.use: to buy packets and sacks of wheat flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Dorica

texts.en:
Dorica M. is a quiet 48-year-old widow with seven children. Her future dream is to venture into a hotel (restaurant) business because she loves to serve people with the best food.

Dorica is currently into poultry farming. She buys her chicks four times a year and rears them until they are old enough and ready for the market. From this she gets to sell both eggs and chickens. She started this business back in 1997 and has never regretted it because of the great income it gives back.

Dorica’s dream is to one day open a Chicken Inn where all the chickens would come fresh from her poultry farm. She requires a Kshs 20,000 loan to buy more chicks and feed and to expand the poultry house.

loans.use: To buy more chicks and feed and to expand the poultry house

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 40 year married with five children aged between 17 and 25 years. Four of her children go to school .She takes care of additional family members. Grace resides and rents a one roomed house where she is staying with five people. There is electricity and piped water at home  The family gets two meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala. Grace sells charcoal on Lubaga road one of roads leading to Kampala city. Grace incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping in villages and uses private means to and from villages.  She doesn’t pay rent for her business but pays monthly market dues. She sells to all categories of people both on retail and whole sale Grace has been in this business for thirteen years and with MCDT for five, servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal. Grace is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and starting going to the villages twice a weeks of now she buys on a monthly basis.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Hawa Gull Group

texts.en:
Hawa G. Group is a group of five borrowers led by Hawa G.. She is 53 years old and is married with three children aged 16 to 21 years old, with educational levels of 7th through 9th grade. Hawa and her family live in the Old Road community south of Monrovia, the capital of Liberia, but she works in the Joeba Market in Old Road.

Hawa's business is selling general goods. She buys wholesale goods like soap, candles, detergent, body cream, etc., and sells retail in the Joeba market. She has been running this business for six years and hopes to grow her little shop to a bigger store in order to improve her business. She talks to her customers with a good manner in order to encourage them to continue buying from her.

Hawa needs this loan in order to purchase new goods. She dreams of improving the living standard of herself and her family and of giving her children a better education.

loans.use: To buy new goods to improve her business

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 42-year-old married woman with four children aged between 21 and 27 years. Three of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. Sarah resides in and owns an eight-roomed house where she lives with seven people. There is electricity and piped water at home and the family gets three meals a day.

Sarah resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She sells chapattis (flat bread) and samosas (fried or baked triangular-shaped pastry shells with a savory filling) on Lubaga Road, one of roads leading to Kampala City.

Sarah incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping in Kikuubo, one of busiest places in Kampala city. She doesn’t pay rent but pays monthly market dues. She sells to all categories of people both retail and wholesale.

Sarah has been in this business for twenty years and with MCDT for six and is servicing her eighteenth loan, working with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more cooking oil, baking flour and baking powder. She aspires to seeing her business grow bigger and to starting a complete bakery.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, baking flour and baking powder

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena is fifty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to eight children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town.

Helena is a trader. She prepares and sells palm oil. She supplies to retailers and also treks to nearby communities to sell. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy palm nuts in bulk.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts in bulk

loans.name: Hayford

texts.en: Hayford is thirty – three years old. He is married and has given birth to four children, all in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town. Hayford is a trader. He trades in maize. He buys bags of maize from nearby towns and supplies to food vendors and retailers in his community. Hayford has been in business for six years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema is a 40 married with three children aged between 3 and 12 years. Her children go to school .She takes care of additional family members. Rehema resides and rents a one roomed house where she is staying with four people. There is electricity and no piped water at home  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala in Ndeeba zone. Rehema works seven days a week. She buys yellow bananas from the very place she works and doesn’t incur extra transport costs to and from shopping.  She doesn’t pay rent but pays monthly market dues.She sells to all categories of people both on retail and whole sale Rehema has been in this business for 12 years and with MCDT for five, servicing her fourteenth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bunches and clusters of yellow bananas and. Rehema is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and start buying  directly from farmers

loans.use: to buy more yellow bananas

loans.name: Alhaji

texts.en: Alhaji is thirty – six years old. He is married and has given birth to three children, all in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town. He is a trader. Alhaji trades in maize. He buys bags of maize from nearby towns and supplies to food vendors and retailers in his community. He also deals in livestock. Alhaji has been in business for over ten years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is a 43 married with four children aged between 4 and 10 years. Her children go to school .She takes care of additional family members. Judith resides and rents a three roomed house where she is staying with five people. There is electricity and no piped water at home  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala in Ndeeba zone. Judith works seven days a week. She buys, crates of beer, Local Gin and soda fro delivery trucks and doesn’t incur extra transport costs to and from shopping.  She doesn’t pay rent as she works from her home.She sells to all categories of people both on retail and whole sale Judith has been in this business for 18 years and with MCDT for seven, servicing her fourteenth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more crates of soda beer and local Gin. Judith is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and starting a beer Deport.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and soda

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice I. is married and is the mother of two children who are still school-going.

Alice started her farming business in 2007. This was after she realized, as she says it, life was not just about being a housewife. She then ventured into a farm produce business which she says is a good income-generating activity.

Alice needs a loan of Kshs 10,000 which she says will be used to buy more seeds besides preparing a larger farm than she used the previous season. She says this will enable her to produce a larger harvest which will mean good business. Her future plan is to open a farm produce store in the future.

loans.use: To buy more seeds and to prepare a larger farmland

loans.name: Donah's Group

texts.en: Donah K. is 34 years old and the leader of her group in Bushenyi. She is a married woman with three children who are all enrolled in school. Donah has been in the business of selling milk for three years and would like to use the loan so she may offset the high electricity costs the operation of her business requires and to increase her turn-over cycles. She hopes that her business savvy and good customer service will allow her to attract more customers thereby increasing her profits. Her dream is that one day all of her children may have the opportunity to be educated at the university level.

loans.use: More Milk that she may Sell

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is thirty-two years old. He is married and has one child who is in school. He lives with his wife and daughter in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town.

Evans is a trader. He runs a provision store. He buys his goods from Kumasi and sells in a shop by the roadside. He has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy provisions in bulk

loans.name: Ramblic

texts.en: Ramblic is forty – six years old. He is married and has given birth to two children, both in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town. Ramblic is a trader. He runs a provision store. He buys his goods from Kumasi and sells in a shop by the road side. He has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to increase his stock.

loans.use: To buy provision

loans.name: Aggrey

texts.en: Aggrey O. is a married man and the father of five children. He is 39 years of age.  He says he retired early since he already had ventured into farming and realized he earned more from it than from his current work back in 2007. Aggrey is very passionate about farming and says he intends to prepare more land for farming and to buy more fertilizer and seeds. He requires a loan of Kshs. 10,000, which he says will spearhead his dream of venturing into large production, and thus he will be able to sell his farm produce to schools and factories by tender.

loans.use: Buy seeds and prepare land for farming

loans.name: Klizisto's Group

texts.en: N. Klizisto is the leader of his lending group in Mukono. He is a hard working and responsible man with a wife and 7 children all in school although 3 of them are soon completing and in higher institutions of learning. He also helps to take care of other orphans and dependants belonging to his late siblings. Klizisto is a business man involved in fishing whereby he sells most of the fish that that he catches from Terere landing site as well as selling to his retail customers using his bicycle to move the fish around to his customers. Fishing is his first job ever since he was a teenager and he is happy that it is paying. He has been able to educate his children as well as acquiring tangible property out of it plus with the help of loans. He has his own boats that he uses to fish and as he saves, he needs to buy another boat for expansion. He needs a loan to help buy more fishing materials like fishing nets, hooks, and jecks for improved service.

loans.use: Buying more fishing materials like hooks, fishing nets and jecks for improved services.

loans.name: United Friends Progressive Organization Group

texts.en:
United Friends Progressive Organization is a group of 4 borrowers led by Martin G., who is 51 years old.  He is married with 6 children between the ages of four and 26, and their educational levels range from kindergarten to the 11th grade.  He also cares for an orphan.  Martin is a high school graduate but could not continue university due to poverty.  He and his family live on the 20th Street, Sinkor, a community mixed with poor and middle class Liberians.  Martin happens to fall in the poorer part of Sinkor, south of the capital Monrovia, Liberia.

Martin’s business is shoe sales.  He buys shoes wholesale and sells them for retail in downtown Monrovia, Liberia.  He has been running this business for 25 years and is hoping to improve his business to the highest level possible.  Martin started by working as a salesman for his brother but later decided to establish his own business.  Since Martin started his business, he always keeps his goods clean and arranged in an ideal location to attract customers, and during transactions he approaches them in a good manner in order to encourage them to always buy from him.  Martin needs this loan in order to buy more goods to serve customers.  He dreams of  giving his children a better education to prepare them for the future to come.

loans.use: Martin needs this loan in order to buy more goods to serve customers

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is forty–two years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa, in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town. Joyce is a trader and trades in vegetables. She buys from Kumasi and supplies to food vendors and other retailers in her community. Joyce also treks to nearby communities to sell. She has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: acheter des noix de palme

loans.name: Violet

texts.en: Violet N. is a 38 year old married, polite, woman, who is blessed with seven children. She says her family is a big family, thus it takes more than a retail shop to take care of every one of its needs. That is why she dropped her first business, a retail shop, to venture into the farm produce business. She says from this it was possible to kill two birds with one stone: both feed her family and sell some of the produce to earn income. Violet requires a loan of Kshs. 10,000 to prepare for the oncoming rainy season. She says she will use this to prepare her vast land and get fertilizer, seeds and hire labor to help prepare in time for the rains. Her future ambition is to one day be able to build rental houses from the income she gets from the farm produce sales.

loans.use: Hire farm labor, prepare land, and buy seeds and fertilizer

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris is thirty – two years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town. She is a food vendor. She prepares and sells kenkey with pepper and fried fish. She buys bags of maize from nearby towns. Doris has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise to resell from her kiosk

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar is a 35 year old woman who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with her husband. Samar has been working as a hairdresser for ten years. Samar doesn’t own a hairdressing salon and doesn’t work from her house, rather she goes to her clients. This means she works only when she has clients. Samar requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase new tools, as well as to pay for her children’s school tuition. This is her second cycle and she has always paid on time.

Samar's work is special because she knows how to treat her clients well and is aware of new hairstyles. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she faced some financial issues which is why she decided to be a mobile hairdresser. Samar decided to do this business because of her experience. In the future, she plans on having more clients in order to have greater income.

loans.use: To purchase new tools, as well as to pay for her children’s school tuition

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina is thirty-two years old. She is married and has two children, both in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town. Faustina is a baker. She bakes bread and supplies to other retailers and beverage sellers in her community. She buys bags of flour and other ingredients from Kumasi. Faustina hawks items in her community. She has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to buy flour and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy supplies in bulk

loans.name: Douha

texts.en: Douha is a 35-year-old married woman with 2 children. She has owned a clothes shop since 2002 to earn income to help her husband in the household. Today, Douha is requesting to borrow $1,200 to purchase additional clothes for her shop as a stock.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: effectur du labour

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad is a 43 year old man who lives in Beirut, capital of Lebanon with his wife. Mouhamad has owned a women's clothing shop since 1984. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase merchandise for his shop especially since the winter season is coming soon. This is his third loan cycle and he has always repaid on time. 
His previous loans helped him diversify his merchandise and expand his stock. Mouhamad is special in his work because of his variety and quality of his sales. His clients are his friends and neighbors. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work and use his experience in trading. In the future, he plans on growing his business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for his shop for the winter season

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica E. is divorced and has four children. She has received a high school education.  Monica has been selling clothing, earrings, ladies bags and so on in Elmina since 2006.  Monica uses her income in paying of fees and settlement of utility bills.  Monica will use the loan to buy more clothing and earrings in bulk. With the new profits from her expanded business, Monica plans to save to buy land.

loans.use: To buy clothing and earrings in bulk.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en: Khalil is a married man with one child. He's 34 years old. He has been engraving since 1993 and he supports his family with this business. Khalil is applying for a loan of $800 to buy a car to be able to travek and satisfy the demands of his clients more quickly.

loans.use: To buy a car for his business

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is a 41 year old woman who lives in Beirut, capital of Lebanon. Sanaa has been working as a sewer since 1998. Sanaa sews all type of clothes like men’s suits, women’s dresses etc. Sanaa requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a new sewing machine. This new machine will help her improve her work. Sanaa has been a microcredit client for seven years now and has always paid on time. 
Sanaa is special in her work because she knows how to treat her clients and does it well since she has experience. Her clients are mainly her friends and neighbors; she also works for clothing shops. When she first started her business, she didn’t face any difficulty since she used to work in a sewing factory. Sanaa decided on doing her business because after the war she had to stop working. Therefore, she decided to have an independent work. In the future, she plans to keep on the good work.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is fifty-two years old. She is married and has three children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town. Janet is a trader. She trades in soap – both toilet and washing soap. She buys cartons of soap from Kumasi and distributing vans that come around to supply. Janet hawks them in her community and also treks to nearby communities to sell. She has been in business for over ten years and would like a loan to buy cartons of soap in bulk.

loans.use: To buy cartons of soap in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: acheter des marchandises pour sa boutique

loans.name: Imelda N.

texts.en:
Imelda hails from Nambale, Busia District, Kenya. She is 38 years old, married and the mother of 8 children. Before 2003, she was involved in the grocery business. She quit this and ventured into the cereals business. She buys her stock of cereals from Busia town twice a month and operates in two markets called Malanga and Nambale. Imelda believes in women's empowerment in entrepreneurship even though this is rare in her village.
Imelda requests a loan of Kshs. 10,000 to buy more cereals and expand her business. It is her dream to open a cereal storehouse in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more cereal and increase stock.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Samir

texts.en: Samir is a very hardworking married man and father of 3 children. He has been working as a farmer from 18 years ago and in 2006, he decided to have his own business in this agriculture sector. Today, Samir is requesting to borrow $1,000 to develop and expanding his business by purchasing an irrigation system.

loans.use: purchasing an irrigation system

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 37 year old man who lives in Beirut, capital of Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Omar has owned a grocery store since 2003. He sells candies, raw materials, canned food, cheese etc. He has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store to increase his stock. This is the first time that Omar has requested a loan.
Omar is special in his work because he owns a large variety of products. His clients are his friends and neighbors. Omar’s grocery store is very well located and he is well-known is his region. He decided on doing this business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by opening another grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for his store.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, both in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town. Comfort is a trader. She trades in utensils – cooking utensils, bowls, etc. She buys sets of plates, bowls, etc. from Kumasi. Comfort hawks to sell in her community and also treks to nearby communities to sell. She has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy utensils

loans.name: Souhayla

texts.en:
Souhayla is a 72 year old woman who lives in Beirut, capital of Lebanon with her husband and their seven children. Souhayla has been working as a sewer since her younger age. Souhayla sews all type of clothes like men’s suits, women’s dresses etc, but she mainly sews clothes for school (the school costumes). Souhayla is never tired from working, she hopes that she will stay in her good shape and be able to work. Her work helps her supplement her family’s income. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a new sewing machine. This new machine will help her improve her work and increase her production. Souhayla has been a microcredit client for five years now and has always paid on time. 
Souhayla is special in her work because she knows how to treat her clients and does it well since she has experience. Her clients are mainly her friends and neighbors; she also works for public schools. When she first started her business, she didn’t face any difficulty. Souhayla decided on doing her business because she sews since she is young.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Youness

texts.en: Youness is a 24-year-old single man living with his parents. After graduating from the university in 2007, he decided to open his own business in computer programmer. Today, Youness is requesting to borrow $1,200 to renovate his shop in order to attract more clients and increase his income.

loans.use: to renovate his shop

loans.name: Randa

texts.en:
Randa is a 49 year old woman who lives in Beirut, capital of Lebanon with her husband and their child. Randa has been sewing and selling clothes from her house since 2000. She mainly sells women and lingerie. Randa requested a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase new clothes to sell. This is her second cycle and she has paid her first loan back on time. 
Randa is special in her work because she sells good quality of clothes, as well as she keeps current styles. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she didn’t have a lot of cash to expand her stock but worked hard to succeed. Randa decided on doing her business because she has a large network. In the future, she plans to keep on working hard and becoming financially successful.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia is 26 years old and a single mother. She has a seven-year-old daughter that is in third grade. Alicia lives on the street Tape Tuya of the city of Itá. For her profession, Alicia has had a grocery store for six years and also owns a cantina in the Panchito López School, the same work with the better objective to make a better life for her family. It is not easy to raise her daughter because she is a single parent. She decided to trust Fundación Paraguaya to make her business better and to sustain her family. Alicia took the loan and invested in her business to buy milk, candies, meat, noodles, soda, cold cuts, vegetables, and more for her pantry shop.

loans.use: Foodstuffs

loans.name: Margaret  Njeri

texts.en:
Margaret is married to Julius and they have no children yet.

Margaret has been in the business of selling second hand clothes for five years. She was introduced to KADET by existing borrowers and she has no previous credit history. The loan she receives will be used to add to her stock of second hand skirts and blouses for sale.

Margaret's area of business is in a busy market, and thus has a lot of customers who pass by through the market. With the extra profit, Margaret intends to open another stall.

Margaret hopes to be able to sell the clothes in wholesale one day, and believes she is hardworking.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: The loan will be used to add to her stock of second hand skirts and blouses for sale.

loans.name: Jakline

texts.en:
Jakline is a 33 year old woman who lives in Beirut, capital of Lebanon with her husband and their child. Jakline has been perfumes essence since 2003. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase new perfumes essence that are more adapted for the winter season. Jakline has been a microcredit client for five years now and has always paid on time. 
Jakline is special in her work because she is the only one in her region selling perfume essence. Her clients can be anybody from or outside her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t have a lot of cash to expand her stock. Jakline decided on doing her business because she used to work in a perfume factory and she learned the business. In the future, she plans on improving her work by changing her shop location and having a bigger shop.

loans.use: To purchase new perfumes essence.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina N. is a 52 year old woman, a mother of 7 children, and a sole owner of a farming business. One unique thing about Selina’s business from the rest in Malanga village, Busia District, Kenya is its specialty in groundnuts (peanuts). She says she started in 2004 and she has really enjoyed it due to the monotony on large scale groundnut farming she does. Before she started this business, she says she had spent decades just being a house wife and if she could go back, she would definitely do otherwise. According to her, it’s not too late; she still has the muscle to go on.
Selina requests a loan of Kshs. 10,000 which she will inject as capital into this business. Her dream is to make sure all her seven children acquire the highest level of education.

loans.use: To buy seeds and expand her farming area.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is thirty-five years old. She is married and has two children, both in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town. Martha is a trader. She trades charcoal. She buys bags of charcoal from nearby towns and supplies them to food vendors and retailers in her community. Martha has been in business for four years and requests a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Atilana

texts.en:
Atilana is 65 years old and married to Mauro, who is 62. They have been together for 40 years and they have two older children who are married and live in their own homes. Atilana married Mauro when they were very young and together they have had many inconveniences but their knowledge has exceeded the constant financial strains on them. They managed to help their children grow up to be good people and gave them a good enough education to finish their university degrees: one in agronomics and the other in law.

Atilana has a grocery store in her own house and Mauro sells coal in his car. They have a good number of clients and they don’t want to stop the coal business because they accommodate many people. They are very happy with their work because it has produced very good results for them financially. They want to take a loan to buy more merchandise such as wheat, rice, sugar and drinks for the grocery store and they also want to buy coal for Mauro to sell.

loans.use: To buy wheat, rice, sugar and drinks for a grocery, and coal to sell

loans.name: Badrieh

texts.en:
Badrieh is a 64 year old woman who lives in Beirut, capitA. of Lebanon with her husband and their eight children. badrieh has been working as a sewer since 1977. Badrieh sews all type of clothes like men’s suits, women’s dresses etc. Badrieh. Her work helps her supplement her family’s income. She requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase materials for her sewing. Badrieh has been a microcredit client for seven years now and has always paid on time. 
Badrieh is speciA. in her work because she knows how to treat her clients and does it well since she has experience. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she had some financiA. issues. Badrieh decided on doing her business because she sews since she is young.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her sewing.

loans.name: Margaret  Achieng

texts.en:
Margaret is separated and she takes care of her five children: Yuder (27), Hellen (25), Jared (15), Winnie (14), and Vincent (9). Margaret has been in the charcoal sales business for two years. She was introduced to KADET by current borrowers and she has no previous credit history. Margaret intends to use her loan to increase her stock of charcoal ahead of the rainy season to help maintain or increase her income. Margaret's business is located in a highly populated area and she is the only one selling charcoal thus she gets good sales. With her profits, Margaret intends to add some groceries and operate a grocery business on the side. Margaret hopes to open a wholesale business one day and distribute charcoal to other vendors as she is a hardworking entrepreneur.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients. KADET provides financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is a microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke/.

loans.use: To increase her stock of charcoal

loans.name: Abed Elnaser

texts.en:
Abed Elnaser has owned a grocery store for over a year. He sells candies, canned food, cheese, etc. He carries a large variety of products. His clients are his friends and neighbors. He didn’t face difficulties starting his business. He decided on this business because he wanted to work independently.

Abed Elnaser is a 45-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife. He has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to increase his stock. This is the first time that Abed Elnaser has requested a loan.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilisers and to hire help for the harvest.

loans.name: Irene Fanny

texts.en:
Irene is 36 years old and has three children. Her eldest child, aged 18, attends university, and the younger two children, aged 14 and 9, attend a nearby public school. Irene has six cows on her dairy farm, but the milk they provide has not been sufficient for her to gain the returns she needs to cover her children's education, so she also sells clothing in the local markets.

Irene has been working on the dairy farm now for over 20 years, and has been selling clothing in the markets for the past five years. She lives in Malco Rancho, in the Quillacollo Province of Cochabamba Department. With this loan from CIDRE, Irene is going to purchase more livestock in order to produce more milk. She hopes this will help her improve her economic situation.

Irene's husband left her and the children a few years ago, so she has been forced to care for and raise the children on her own. Although she has had to fill the roles of both mother and father, her children are her inspiration and she wishes for nothing more than their success.

loans.use: The purchase of livestock

loans.name: Lilian Carminia

texts.en:
Lilian is a 26-year-old married mother of two children. Her children are 9 and 3 years old, and she has been married now for over 8 years. She works primarily as a dairy cow farmer and also raises crops.

Lilian began working about 8 years ago, when she had only two cows and primarily grew corn. She is a very hard and tireless worker, and she now has many cows, pigs, turkeys, chickens, in addition to several crops that she grows.

Lilian's family lives with her parents in the town of Mallco Rancho, of Quillacollo Province, which is just outside of the city of Cochabamba. Lilian's husband has been working in Spain for nearly three years, so she has been running the farm on her own. She hopes that he returns home soon so they can begin work building a home on a plot of land that she inherited from her father.

With this loan from Kiva's partner CIDRE, she plans to purchase fodder for her livestock, such as soy husks and alfalfa. She believes the loan will help to increase her earnings buy providing her cows with more food, so that they will in turn produce more milk.

loans.use: Purchase of fodder for livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: acheter des engrais et d'autres intrants agricoles

loans.name: Kuña Arandu Group

texts.en:
The committee Kuña Arandú formed on June 23rd, 2009, thanks to Gregoria R., who contacted the Fundacion Pargauya on founding a Women’s Committee. After a few days they formed a group of 18 women, who are all now working with Fundacion Paraguaya.

On average, each group member took out a loan of 455,000 Gs., which is intended for different activities such as selling grocery items (rice, sugar, dairy, baked goods, meat, etc.), cosmetics, crafts, etc.

Noelia R. wants to use her loan to sell cosmetics.  
Gregoria R. wants to use her loan to sell ñandutí. 
Gloria V. wants to use her loan to sell food. 
Gilda A. wants to use her loan to sell her artwork. 
Claudia E. wants to use her loan to sell her artwork. 
Petrona J. wants to use her loan to sell food. 
Blanca E. wants to use her loan to sell her artwork. 
Marcelina A. wants to use her loan to sell her artwork. 
Luz A. wants to use her loan to sell her artwork. 
María C. wants to use her loan for her grocery store. 
Pabla V. wants to use her loan to sell chips. 
Sonia V. wants to use her loan to sell aperitifs. 
Mirta V. wants to use her loan to sell food. 
Rumilda E. wants to use her loan to sell her artwork. 
Benicia E. wants to use her loan to sell food. 
Delia R. wants to user her loan to sell her artwork. 
Laura F. wants to user her loan for teaching. 
Nadia F. wants to use her loan to be a domestic maid.

loans.use: Foodstuffs, merchandise

loans.name: Benardine

texts.en:
Benardine O. is 34 years old and a mother of two children. She is a wife, a teacher and a business woman at the same time.

She used to own a small retail shop which she closed because it was not giving back. She then ventured into opening a maize mill and realized there was a great demand for maize. This is the reason she finally ventured into cereals business with specialization in maize.

Benardine needs a loan of Kshs. 20,000 to increase the stock of maize and increase her capital base. She restocks twice a week and her wish is to one day open a larger store and widen her market as far as the capital city of Kenya, Nairobi.

loans.use: INCREASE STOCK.

loans.name: Maher

texts.en: Maher has been working as a flooring man since 2004 to earn income to meet the needs of his family, as he is the one supporting them. He is a 31-year-old married man with two children. There is great demand for his work, thus he wants to buy additionA. tools and a car in order to fill the orders of his clients.

loans.use: To buy additional tools

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.en: Hiyam is a 30-year-old single woma living with her parents. She has been working as an accountant since 2002. in order to develop her work, Hiyam is requesting her loan of $1,000 to buy a table to facilitate her work and adding new decoration.

loans.use: buy a table to facilitate her work and adding new decoration

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To hire help for the harbest and to purchase fertilisers.

loans.name: Wilfridah

texts.en:
Wilfridah O. boasts of being the only sisal rope maker in the whole of her village. Unlike many businesses, she says this is pure art and not just the exchange of money and goods. “You have to be skilled to produce a perfect rope that can hold and last,” she says.

Wilfridah is 51 years old, married and blessed with 11 children. She started her business back in 1990 and admits she did it because the competition was low as most people back then preferred easy money: buying goods and selling the goods. She says she prefers to be the manufacturer and enjoys the joy of creation. She requires a loan of 10,000 shillings which she will use to purchase raw materials from the sisal plant. Her future dream is to open a mega-store for sisal ropes and products.

loans.use: To buy more sisal to make rope

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.en:
The committee Kuña Guapa is an excellent committee formed on March 17th, 2009, comprising of 20 women of the city of Ita. This Group was formed by Gloria G., who decided to get together with her neighbors and friends from the Neighbhorhood San Antonio and create a program for Women Entrepreneurs. They are now operating in the third cycle of their program. They are all very happy because thanks to their joint work, they can move forward with their work and continue to make their lives better. The majority of the members began with the credit granted by Fundacion Paraguaya. 
	The credit given to the committee is 575,000 Gs. The members of the group are using the loan for different activitives such as the sale of ingredients for food preparation, parchase of dry goods for grocery stores (sugar, rice, baked goods, dairy, meat, etc.) products for manicures and pedicures, selling jewelry, lingerie, clothing, drinks, dressmaking, etc. 
	They are a very active group, and all members demonstrate solidarity and fellowship, attending weekly meetings and fundraising activities conducted for the common good of the group. It is one of the best program working with Fundacion Paraguaya. 
Nancy N. wants to use her loan to sell silverware. 
Leidyd G. wants to use her loan to sell clothes. 
Evelin G. wants to use her loan to sell silverware. 
Ida F. wants to use her loan to sell clothes. 
Gloria G. wants to use her loan to sell silverware. 
Laura G. wants to use her loan to sell lingerie. 
Liliana G. wants to use her loan to sell lingerie. 
Zulma O. wants to use her loan to sell clothes. 
Esperanza G. wants to use her loan to sell clothes. 
Isabel G. wants to use her loan to sell candies. 
Eustacia C. wants to use her loan to buy products for manicures and pedicures. 
Isabel R. wants to use her loan to sell food. 
Myrian I. wants to use her loan to sell food. 
Carmen J. wants to use her loan to sell lingerie. 
Eulalia R. wants to use her loan to sell drinks. 
Esmilda P. wants to use her loan to sell food. 
Deysi M. wants to use her loan to sell clothes. 
Lucina G. wants to use her loan for tailoring. 
Liz M. wants to use her loan to sell silverware. 
Mirna V. wants to use her loan to sell footware.

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilisers.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
Adelaida es socia del Banco Comunal Pueblo Libre que significa Nuestra Fuerza en quechua.
Adelaida es casada, tiene 39 años y 1 hijo, Adelaida viaja a las ferias de la región en donde vende mantas que manda a tejer, además vende ropa variada, actividad que realiza 3 días a la semana.
Adelaida necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de mantas.
Adelaida sueña con tener una casa propia y que su hijo culmine sus estudios.
texts.en:
Adelaida is a member of the Pueblo Libre, which means Our Strength in Quechua, Communal Bank. Adelaida is 39, married, and has one child. Adelaida travels to regional fairs where she sells blankets that she has woven. She also sells various clothing. She does this three days a week. Adelaida needs a loan for 900 PEN to buy blankets. Adelaida’s dream is to have her own house and that her son finishes his education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy blankets

loans.name: Abimael Jhon

texts.es:
Abimael es socia del Banco Comunal Pueblo Libre que significa Nuestra Fuerza en quechua.
Abimael es soltera, tiene 20 años y vive con sus padres, Abimael tiene un carro con el cual realiza transporte de pasajeros a la comunidad de Mollepata, además en algunas oportunidades vende abarrotes junto a sus padres en diferentes pueblos.
Abimael necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la reparación de su carro.
Los sueños de abimael son tener casa propia, comprar otro carro y estudiar topografía.

loans.use: Para la reparación de su carro.

loans.name: Mari Luz

texts.es:
Mariluz es socia del Banco Comunal Pueblo Libre que significa Nuestra Fuerza en quechua.
Mariluz es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 1 hijo, Mariluz vende cosméticos por catálogos que ofrece a amigos y familiares, sus ventas son al crédito, además vende sabanas de acuerdo a pedidos.
Mariluz necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de sabanas.
Mariluz sueña que su hijo culmine sus estudios.

loans.use: Para la compra de sabanas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertiliser and other agricultural products.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 24-year-old married man with one child. He has been working as a carpenter since 1999 when he was too young. He is a very hardworking man and with his loan of $1,000 he will invest in buying more supplies and make some modifications in his business to continue earning a good income for his family.

loans.use: buying more supplies and make some modifications in his business

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.en:
La Amistad is called the most humble committee of women, who struggle every day to get ahead and advance both personally and financially. It was formed in the city of Capiata on June 18th, 2009 by Olga M., who contacted an employee at a weekly meeting in the area to start a Women Entrepreneurs Committee. She gathered 15 women together who work well in solidarity but are comfortable in a partnership. 
The group took out a loan of 437,000 Gs., which is intended for different activities such as selling food, goods for grocery stores (rice, sugar, noodles, dairy, baked goods, etc.) clothing, lingerie, handicrafts, perfumes, coal, etc. 
Eleuteria B. wants to use her loan for her grocery store. 
Rosa C. wants to use her loan to sell perfume. 
Irma C. wants to use her loan to sell food and perfume. 
Yolanda A. wants to use her loan to sell coal. 
Olga M. wants to use her loan to sell food. 
Beatriz A. wants to use her loan for her gocery store. 
Miriam A. wants to use her loan to sell clothes. 
Elida P. wants to use her loan to sell baked goods. 
Pastora C. wants to use her loan to sell electrical appliances. 
Lidia M. wants to sell fruits and vegetables. 
Elsa A. wants to sell food and natural remedies. 
María M. wants to sell cheap jewerly. 
Margarita Duré wants to sell articles of iron. 
Laura B. wants to sell clothes. 
Teresa E. wants to sell clothes and food. 
Ilda A. wants to sell food.

loans.use: Foodstuffs, merchandise

loans.name: Nyamboko

texts.en: Nyamboko J.'s choice of business is carpentry which he started in 2007. He is a 60-year-old father of seven children and also a husband. He was formerly an employee in the civil service but he has retired and decided to venture into business. He buys stock from Nambale, Busia District, Kenya, twice a week. He requires a loan of 15,000 shillings which he will use to buy timber and more tools. Doing this, he says, will guarantee a better profit which will translate into further education for his seven children. His dream is to make sure all his children attend college.

loans.use: To increase timber stocks and buy carpentry tools

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.use: effectuer des labours et acheter des engrais

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: effectuer du labour et acheter des engrais

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: acheter des engrais

loans.name: Acholla

texts.en:
Acholla D. is a retired teacher who is 62years old, married and blessed with four children. He started his farming business in the year 1999 and says it has never let him down because of the two rainy seasons in Nambale, Busia District. Acholla travels by bus twice every year to purchase and restock his seeds for planting. But this is just the beginning of his journeys – he says that after harvest, he travels far and wide to supply his varied clientele.

Acholla requires a loan of Kshs.15,000 shillings which he will use to restock his seeds, prepare his farming land, acquire fertilizer and pesticides, and expand. As a former teacher, he believes education and talent are keys to success. He wants a secure future for his children and he will not stop until there is enough income to see his children through.

loans.use: To buy seeds and expand farming area

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: acheter des engrais

loans.name: Hilarion

texts.en:
Hilarion is 26 years old and has a common-law wife and a son who is two. For the past five years he has been working with his father in both bricklaying and agriculture. While Hilarion primarily spends his time working as a bricklayer, he dedicates his weekends to cultivating yucca, citrus fruits and other crops.

Hilarion has requested a loan from CIDRE (Centro de Investigation y Desarrollo Regional, or Regional Center for Research and Development) that will be used to expand his cultivation of citrus fruits on his farm. Recently, he bought a plot of land in an urban area where he is constructing a home. Hilarion hopes this loan will help him to increase his earnings so he will be able to finish construction on his home and so raise his family's quality of life.

This loan is located in the Chapare region of Bolivia’s Cochabamba Department. Chapare is Bolivia's largest producer of coca used for illegal cocaine production. Part of CIDRE's mission in Chapare is to give low-interest loans to both incentivize and encourage these farmers to cultivate alternative crops rather than coca. Alternative-to-coca programs like CIDRE's help ensure that these farmers will be incorporated into a legally regulated and consequently more sustainable sector of the economy.

loans.use: To his expand cultivation of citrus fruits

loans.name: Felinda Caridad

texts.es:
La señora Felinda Caridad B. C.  es socia activa del Banco Comunal Dulce Amistad ubicado en  Rocafuerte, provincia de Manabí; ella vive en la comunidad Las Jaguas a unos diez minutos de la ciudad de Rocafuerte.  Este lugar  se caracteriza por ser  un centro turístico donde todos los fines de semana  llega mucha gente a recrearse con toda la familia y a degustar de la mejor comida típica de la región.

Felinda tenía un terreno con pasto para su ganado porque su esposo se dedicaba a la cría y venta de ganado vacuno en la región,  entonces decidió ocupar una parte del terreno y montó su restaurante de comida típica llamado  Valle Hermoso, ya lleva tres años en esta actividad junto a su esposo y sus hijos; nos asegura que le va muy bien  y los platos más apetecidos por los turistas  son: caldo de gallina, empanadas, suero blanco, bolones, seco de gallina criolla, etc.

Con el crédito que la Fundación ESPOIR le entregue va a incrementar su negocio comprando otros productos para preparar  otros platos típicos como pescados, camarones, además un bar en el que ofrecerá bebidas gaseosas, agua mineral  y cerveza.
texts.en:
Mrs. Felinda Caridad B. C. is an active member of the Sweet Friendship Community Bank located in Rocafuerte in the province of Manabí. She lives in the community of Las Jaguas, about ten minutes from the city of Rocafuerte. This area is characterized by being a tourism center which many people visit every weekend to enjoy themselves and sample the best traditional food of the region. Felinda had a plot of pasture land for her cattle because her husband worked raising and selling cattle in the region. She decided to use part of the land and set up a traditional food restaurant called Valle Hermoso (Beautiful Valley). She has run the business for three years, with her husband and their children. She assures us that it is going very well and the dishes most fancied by the tourists are: chicken soup, empanadas, suero blanco (whey from milk), bolones (banana/egg pastry), seco de gallina criolla (a chicken dish with a traditional sauce), etc. With this loan from the Foundation ESPOIR she will increase her business by buying other products to prepare other traditional dishes like fish and shrimp, and a bar which will offer soft drinks, mineral water, and beer.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to add other traditional dishes and start a bar with soft drinks.

loans.name: Vitaliy

texts.en:
Vitaliy is married with two adult children. He has a retail business selling vegetables and animal food. He has a large storage place next to his home and sells his products right outside his gates. Vitaliy has been in this business for ten years. He has a very good business location—by a busy road—and many repeat clients. Vitaliy uses his truck to buy and transport the produce.

Vitaliy is requesting a loan of 11,124 UAH to buy more produce for sale. It is the high season for sales now, and he wants to take advantage of it to increase his profits. His ultimate goal is to purchase a newer and bigger truck to help him further develop his business.

loans.use: To purchase more produce

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel O. is a forty-year-old father of seven children who specializes in shoemaking. In 1999, after graduation from Nambale Youth Polytechnic in the Busia district, he straight away ventured into shoemaking as his profession and private business. He goes to Nairobi, the capital of Kenya, once every month to buy materials for making shoes.

Gabriel is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES which he will use to buy additional shoe materials and so expand his business. He has high hopes for the oncoming Christmas season and adds that it is a guaranteed high-sales season for him.

loans.use: To buy additional shoemaking materials

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: M. Vincent has four small children and he is a widower. He is 46 years old and specializes in farming as a business. He started this business in 2006 after he lost his job with a security firm. His main priority is to educate his children since he, himself, never got a chance to go to school. M. requires a loan of 20,000 shillings which he plans to use to expand his farming area in preparation for the oncoming season. It is his priority to make sure his children get the best of education and life.

loans.use: To expand and prepare farming area and restock seeds

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: acheter des engrais

loans.name: Mutimba

texts.en: Mutimba M. hawks secondhand clothes, which he buys from Nairobi, Kenya, twice a month. He has been in this kind of business since 1992. He is a jovial family man, 50 years of age, married and blessed with four children. He dreams of building rental houses in the future and says his only way to get to that dream is to succeed in his current business.  He would like a loan of 20,000 shillings which he will use to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.use: To buy more clothing stock

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina sells clothing at the central market in Kherson. She has been in this business for 12 years. She is married and has one child. Irina is the kind of person who, once she decides on something, goes slowly but persistently until she reaches her goal. When she started this business, she really wanted to be economically independent. She has reached that goal now. Today, she has many repeat clients and a stable business. Irina is a very friendly person and has good relationships with her neighbors at the market.

Irina would like to borrow 15,000 hryvnas to increase her inventory. Irina hopes to receive additional income and invest it back into her business.

loans.use: To increase inventory of clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilisers and other agricultural products.

loans.name: Genoveva Bibiana

texts.es:
La señora Genoveva Bibiana García U. es socia activa del Banco Comunal Dulce Amistad ubicado en  Rocafuerte, provincia de Manabí; ella vive en la comunidad Las Jaguas a unos diez minutos de la ciudad de Rocafuerte.  Este lugar  se caracteriza por ser  un centro turístico donde todos los fines de semana  llega mucha gente a recrearse con toda la familia y a degustar de la mejor comida típica.

Genoveva es licenciada en Educación Básica y  su  esposo es Ingeniero  Industrial juntos montaron una micro-empresa donde elaboran chifles, ya llevan cuatro años en este negocio y les ha ido tan bien que su marca es reconocida en toda la provincia de Manabí. 

Las responsabilidades son compartidas, su esposo se  encarga de la distribución a clientes fijos en diferentes cantones,  mientras que Genoveva es la encargada de elaborar los chifles con la ayuda de dos chicos que se dedican a pelar los plátanos, es una ardua tarea pero están felices con todos los logros alcanzados.

Con el préstamo que la Fundación ESPOIR le entregue va hacer elaborar las fundas con el logo tipo de su producto  Chapuchifles  para las próximas entregas.
texts.en:
Señora Genoveva Bibiana García U. is an active member of the Dulce Amistad (Sweet Friendship) Communal Bank located in Rocafuerte, Manabí province. She lives in the community of Las Jaguas, about 10 minutes from the city of Rocafuerte. This place is known for being a tourist center where every weekend many people arrive to enjoy themselves with their families and savor the best traditional foods.

Genoveva is certified in basic education, and her husband is an industrial engineer. Together they run a small business where they manufacture plantain chips. They have been in this business for 4 years and have done so well that their brand is recognized throughout Manabí province.

Responsibilities are shared. Her husband is in charge of distribution to established customers in different districts while Genoveva is in charge of making the plantain chips with the help of two young men who are assigned to peel the bananas. It is hard work, but they are happy with all their success.

With the loan that the ESPOIR Foundation is giving her she is going to manufacture packaging with the trademark of their product (Chapuchifles) for their next deliveries.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase packaging with the trademark of her product for the next deliveries

loans.name: Antenitas Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal denominado  ANTENITAS  está conformado por catorce personas de edades variadas que oscilan desde los 20 a los 60 años. La presidenta de la banca es una persona de carácter fuerte, alegre  y proactiva que tiene 4 hijos de los cuales tres  están  en colegio y la hija mayor si bien vive es su casa es completamente independiente , La Sra. Clementina tesorera  de la banca en una persona muy alegre, determinada y proactiva que en conjunto con sus amigas forman parte de la banca, la Sra. Nicol es la secretaria de la banca es una persona con carácter muy alegre y colaboradora, las otras personas que conforman la banca son de personalidades similares. La presidenta tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de CDs al igual que otro de los socias, la Sra. Clementina administra una  pequeña tienda de abarrotes ubicado en la misma zona donde vende sus CDS la Sra. Beatriz. La Sra. Nicol administra un pequeño negocio de venta de licores y bebidas, otras  socias de dedican a la venta de ropa deportiva, para mujeres, para niños, la Sra. Lourdes de dedica a la venta de artículos de ferretería. Si bien dentro de los lugares donde se desarrollan sus actividades existen otros similares, la afluencia de  consumidores a los mercados, y el constante crecimiento urbano  hace que las actividades que se  desarrollaban en el lugar no se vean afectadas por lo contrario muchas de las socias están esperanzadas en hacer crecer sus negocios ampliándolos por lo cual solicitan el crédito. Las socias solicitan  el crédito para realizar la adquisición de mercadería en mayor cantidad, otras para la compra de materiales de construcción  para el ampliado de sus pequeños locales y dar mejor atención a sus clientes esto para las socias que se dedican a la venta de ropa deportiva los solicitan para el incremento de mercadería. Este grupo se encuentra en su quinto ciclo, lo cual  la mayoría de ellas ya se conocen entre sí y cuentan con experiencia de trabajo en esta modalidad de crédito.
texts.en:
The Atenitas Communal Bank is comprised of 14 people of various ages between 20 and 60. The president of the bank is of strong character, happy, and proactive. She has four children. Three of the children are in school, and her oldest daughter lives in her house and is completely independent. Clementina, the bank treasurer, is happy, determined, and proactive. Together with her friends she forms part of the bank. Nicol is the secretary of the bank. She is a person who has character and is very happy and collaborative. The other people who comprise the bank have similar personalities. The president has a small business selling CDs, the same as other members. Clementina runs a small grocery store, which is located in the same area where Beatriz sells her CDs. Nicol runs a small business selling liquor and drinks. Other members sell sportswear for women and children. Lourdes sells hardware. If there are other places that do the same things in the area, their business are not affected because of the abundance of customers in the markets and the constant urban growth. To the contrary, many of the members are hoping to make their businesses grow by expanding them with a loan. The members are asking for a loan to get greater quantities of merchandise. Others want to buy construction materials to expand their small locations and give their customers better service. The members who sell sportswear want to increase their merchandise. This group is in their fifth cycle. The majority of them know each other and have work experience with this type of loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise and raw material

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan y su esposa Celsa son personas bien trabajadoras y es así que lograron tener su casa propia en la cual viven con sus dos hijos, Juan es maestro albañil hace bastante tiempo y la Celsa se dedica al rubro del comercio de ropa en el mercado de su zona y también hace horneados (pan, empanadas, etc.) Lo cual vende en su barrio en donde es conocida por lo activa que es, el crédito solicitado fue para la compra de un puesto en el mercado de la zona gracias a lo cual la cliente podrá incrementar sus ventas. El Juan es cliente antiguo en la institución es el quinto crédito al que accedió y todos con buen comportamiento, gracias a los prestamos los clientes lograron mejorar su calidad de vida puesto que construyeron su casa y compraron herramientas de trabajo para la actividad del cliente y un horno para que aumente la venta en el negocio de los horneados de Celsa, asimismo el préstamo les permitió ahorrar y obtener capital de trabajo para la venta de ropa lo cual le genera un ingreso adicional.

loans.use: COMPRA PUESTO EN EL MERCADO 26 DE NOVIEMBRE

loans.name: Mercedes Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mercedes esta integrado por tres mujeres luchadoras provenientes del Municipio de Tisma, una zona ganadera, agrícola y pesquera. Este fue centro de discusión por muchos años entre los departamentos de Masaya y Granada.

Milagro de Jesús B. Soza de 37 años es la coordinadora del grupo. Ella desde hace 15 años inicio con la venta de  leña  que poco a poco ha ido creciendo, en la actualidad ella tiene trabajadores que le ayuden a  distribuir el cargamento y su mayor su ello es comprar un terreno.

Lucero L. una joven estudiante de Trabajo Social hace dos años y medio empezó a distribuir productos de la Zermat con lo cual se ayuda para seguir con sus estudios. Mientras María Lourdes M. tiene 14 años vendiendo tortilla y su mayor anhelo es construir su casa.

Ellas invertirán el crédito para adquirir los productos de acuerdo a sus negocios y así prosperar.

loans.use: Para comprar leña

loans.name: Josefa Dolores

texts.es:
La señora Josefa Dolores V. R.   es socia activa del Banco Comunal Dulce Amistad ubicado en  Rocafuerte, provincia de Manabí; ella vive en la comunidad  del mismo nombre.  

Josefa tiene  47 años de edad es  divorciada,  vive con su hija  de 27 años y su yerno, ella es maestra de profesión desde hace 20 años,  se inicio en Pedernales una localidad costera de Manabí, hace dos años se radicó en Rocafuerte  donde actualmente da clase en un colegio, junto a su familia montaron un negocio  donde vende  víveres y electrodomésticos, su  hija es la encargada de administrar.  

 Doña  Josefa manifiesta que le  va muy bien en las ventas, el negocio apenas tiene dos meses y tiene bastantes clientes,  trabaja con crédito directo, ella invierte un capital aproximado de 10.000 dólares en electrodomésticos y productos de primera necesidad.

Con el préstamo que solicitó a la Fundación ESPOIR va a invertir en más electrodomésticos  como: licuadoras, planchas, tostadoras entre otros y,  productos de primera necesidad como: arroz, azúcar, aceite, etc.para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Josefa is an active member of the Sweet Friendship Community Bank, located in Rocafuerte, Manabi Province. She lives in the community of the same name.

Josefa is 47 years old, divorced, and lives with her 27-year-old daughter and son-in-law. She has been a teacher by profession for some 20 years. Her career began in Pedernales, a coastal location in Manabi. Some 2 years ago, she moved to Rocafuerte where she presently teaches in a school. Together with her family, she began a business selling groceries and electric appliances. Her daughter is in charge of running it.

Josefa reports that sales are going very well. The business is just 2 months old and has plenty of customers and works with direct credit. She invested approximately $10,000 in appliances and products of basic necessity.

With the loan she is requesting through the ESPOIR Foundation, she will buy more appliances, including blenders, irons, and toasters among other things, as well as products of basic necessity, such as rice, sugar, oil, etc. This will enable her to better serve her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY DOMESTIC APPLIANCES AND BASIC PRODUCTS LIKE RICE, SUGAR, AND OIL TO RESUPPLY HER STORE

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 41 years old and single. Martha's parents live with her and she is an only child. Because her parents are elderly, she takes care of them and all of their needs.

She has been working as a dairy cow farmer for over 20 years in Esquilan Chico, which is at the southern end of Cochabamba. Martha sells the milk her cows produce to a large local dairy company called Pil.  This company makes all sorts of dairy products, including milk, yogurt, and cheese.  

With this loan from CIDRE, Martha plans to purchase another dairy cow. This will allow her to increase her milk production and also her earnings. Martha hopes that in the future, she can take out another loan to remodel their home so her parents can be more comfortable.

loans.use: The purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buying fertilizer

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es:
La señora Saturnina A. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Villa Brasil, de la ciudad de El Alto, con su esposo y sus cinco hijos.
La señora Saturnina vende comida en un puesto de venta y su esposo vende condimentos a las tiendas de barrio, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la cuota inicial de la compra de un terreno, ya que ellos viven actualmente en casa de sus padres.
Esta es la primera vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.

loans.use: Costo de cuota inicial para la compra de un terreno que servirá para construir su propia casa en un futuro cercano.

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Juan está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras que comercializan las frutas y verduras. Ellas son originarias de la zona rural Quebrada Honda, esta carece de muchos recursos necesarios para la vida como lo es el agua potable.

Aracely de los Ángeles A. hace tres años con ayuda de su suegra puso un pequeño negocio de frutas y verduras en el Mercado Oriental y su mayor su ello es tener su propio tramo. Antonia

loans.use: para comprar frutas y verduras como ayote, yuca, chilote, chayote etc.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua B. sells smoked fish and gari (couscous-like grain made from grated cassava) at Elmina, which she has been doing since 1989. To smoke her fish, she goes to the seashore to buy fresh fish from the seamen. She comes home with the fish, cleans or dresses them, and drains the water that comes from washing the fish. She prepares her traditionally-made oven with firewood to smoke her fish for sale.

Efua is married and has no formal education. Her husband is a fisherman. Efua uses her income to help her husband pay utility bills and for their apartment. Efua will use this loan to buy more fish to smoke and gari to sell. With the profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to save to build.

loans.use: To buy fish to smoke and gari to sell

loans.name: Philomina

texts.en:
Philomina P. is married and has one child. She has received a junior high school education.  Since 2002, Philomina has been selling smoked fish at Elmina near Teterem. Philomina's husband is a pastor, and she uses her income to support him in paying their fees and utility bills.  Philomina will use the loan to purchase more fish to smoke. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save money so that she can build more.

To smoke her fish, first, Philomina must buy fresh fish from the fishermen at the sea shore. She comes home with the fish, cleans or dresses them, and drains the water that comes from washing the fish. Finally, she prepares her traditional oven with firewood in order to smoke her fish for sale.

loans.use: Philomina will use the loan to purchase more fish to smoke.

loans.name: José Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes del grupo José  son originarias de la comarca  El Jocote zona rural del Masaya. Además todas ellas comercializan sus productos en el mercado de Masaya.  

Alma del Socorro C. tiene quince años vendiendo especie como manzanilla, romero, clavo de olor, canela, chilla y otros tipos de productos. Ella ocupara el crédito para adquirir productos que no tienen y los que ella ya comercializa. 

Cándida Rosa J.  y  Reyna Isabel M. ambas tienen un pequeño tramo cada una de frutas y verduras y el sueño de ellas es poder seguir trabajando y seguir con Adim porque es más seguro y económico.

loans.use: para comprar productos como manzanilla, romero...etc

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi K. is single and has no educational background.  Esi sells smoked fish at Elmina near Teterem, which she has been doing since the year 1989. Esi uses her income in paying of utility bills.  Esi will use the loan to buy more fish to smoke. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to save to build.
To smoke her fish, she goes to the sea shore to buy fresh fish form the sea men. She comes home with the fishes cleans or dresses them and drains the water that comes about as a result of washing the fish. She prepares her traditionally make oven with firewood to smoke her fish for sale.

loans.use: Esi will use the loan to buy more fish to smoke.

loans.name: Good News Group

texts.en: Eva is thirty – one years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, both in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town. Eva is a trader. She trades in printed textile materials. She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Good News’. The group is made of mostly traders and food vendors. Some hawk to sell in their community while others also trek to nearby communities to sell. The group wants a loan to help them buy goods in bulk to increase their stock. The group leader, Eva is seated right in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Chicas De Oro Group

texts.es: Las socias de este banco comunal tienen una familia compuesta de cinco integrantes en promedio los padres y tres hijos. Una buena parte de los miembros son solteros (as) con sus actividades propias son gente  de clase media, pero también hay gente de procedencia rural, son de escasos recursos con viviendas de adobe y otros en alquiler. Las actividades que desarrollan los miembros de este banco comunal son  básicamente la comercialización de productos de limpieza, papelería, ferreterías, prendas de vestir, abarrotes, frutas, dulces, refrescos y alimentos procesados y no procesados. En el mercado las socias, existe bastante competencia sin embargo ellas se valen de la rapidez que tienen para cambiar y surtir su mercadería siempre están de acuerdo al comportamiento de las épocas, pero alguna socia del banco fracasan y es la causa de la mora arrastra al grupo. El destino del crédito es principalmente el incremento de su capital de trabajo. La mayoría de los socios tienen experiencia crediticia puesto que no es su primer ciclo, por otra parte fueron parte de grupos en otras instituciones similares, actualmente trabajan solo con nuestra Institución.
texts.en:
This communal bank is comprised of members who have families with the average of five people, the parents and three children. A good part of the members are single with their own activities.
